0.label: Criminal
0.description: You joined up with a pirate crew to evade the law. Take+ 1 ongoing when checking for outstanding warrants, and on a 7 + you can take+ 1 ongoing when intimidating people in that steading.

1.label: Recruit
1.description: You became a pirate willingly after hearing all the stories about treasure and adventure. You start with X Marks The Spot.

2.label: Shanghaied
2.description: When your town was pillaged you were captured at a young age and forced to work. Over many years and fights you managed to earn the respect of your shipmates. When you are outnumbered, gain + 1 armor.

1.label: Chaotic
1.description: Throw your enemies' plans into disarray.

2.label: Evil
2.description: Use threats and violence to make others do what you want.

system.description: When you recruit, take + 1 if the steading has the poor, lawless, or growing tags.
As long as you are also in the thick of it, hirelings in your command have +1 Loyalty.
When you Hack and Slash, take +1 armor forward against your target.
When you deal damage to aquatic foes, deal +1d6 damage.

When you Discern Realities from above or using a spyglass, you can ask the
GM an additional question, and on a miss you can still ask one.
When you scan the environment for an advantage, on a 12+ you hold 3 mayhem.

When you Spout Lore about the deep blue sea and its inhabitants, take + 1
forward when acting on the answers.
When you aid an ally, on a 7+ you also take +1 forward.

When you volley with a firearm, take +1 forward to Hack and Slash against
the same target.
When you wield a weapon with the precise tag, it also gains 2 piercing.
When you Discern Realities, you can always ask where treasure is hidden.

Replaces: From Hell's Heart...

When you deal damage to aquatic foes, deal +2d6 damage.
When you scan the environment for an advantage, you hold 1 additional mayhem, and on a miss you still hold 1 mayhem.
When you tell someone what to do, they take +1 forward if they listen.

You are accustomed to the night: you can see in the dark, and when you Defy
Danger by trying to avoid being spotted or getting out of the way while in
the shadows, a miss counts as a 7-9.
When you undertake a perilous journey across the sea, whatever job you take you succeed as if you rolled a 10+.
When you shoot someone right next to you, the attack ignores armor and deals +1d6 damage.
Guns no longer have the unreliable tag, grenades no longer have the dangerous tag, and you deal +1 damage when using them.
When you Defy Danger against a melee attack and roll a 12+, deal your damage to the attacker.

You recover from the sick debility in just one day, and when you try to resist
or recover from disease, take +1 forward.
When you make camp and pool everyone's resources together, roll+INT.
system.choices:
• 1d6 dungeon rations
  • 1d4 bandages
  • 1 use of adventuring gear

failure.value: You did not have as much as you thought: choose 1 and lose that amount.

system.description: Add 10 coins to your character.
Add 10 coins to your character sheet.
1d10 damage.
system.tagsString: dangerous, thrown, near, loud, 2 piercing, close

system.description: When you scan the environment for an advantate, roll +WIS.
system.choices:
Spend 1 maheml and tell the GM how you use the environment to:

  • Move to a nearby location, or maneuver an enemy to a nearby location.
  • Find a weapon with the hand and near tags.
  • Distract or impede your foe - you or an ally takes +1 forward against them.
  • Take something from the target, or cause it to drop something.

system.description: When you loot a monster, you can increase the result of the treasure roll by 1.  If you find coins, increase the amount by 1d8.
When you defy danger while fighting on a rocking ship, rigging, or any unsteady surface, take +1 forward.
When you arrive at an island you have not been to in a while, the GM will either tell you what you stashed there or what treasure is rumored to be hidden there.

When you break out the rum, demon water, kill-devil, or whatever you want to call it, you can carouse without spending 100 coins (you can still spend 100 coins to gain +1 for each 100 coins spent).  In addition you can take +1 forward, but if you do, things always get out of hand.  When you carouse, the following morning take +1 forward.
